revenue and amounts that will be invoiced and recognized as revenue in future periods $298 $315 $368 $368 $392 $625 Microsoft Cloud revenue Revenue from Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud, Azure and other cloud services, the commercial portion of LinkedIn, and Dynamics 365 $40.9 $42.4 $46.7 $168.9 $49.1 $51.5 Microsoft Cloud revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud, Azure and other cloud services, the commercial portion of LinkedIn, and Dynamics 365 21% / 21% 20% / 22% 27% / 25% 23% / 23% 26% / 25% 26% / 24% Microsoft Cloud gross margin percentage Gross margin percentage for our Microsoft Cloud business 70% 69% 68% 69% 68% 67% Productivity &amp; Business Processes and Intelligent Cloud Microsoft 365 Commercial cloud revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Microsoft 365 Commercial subscriptions, comprising Microsoft 365 Commercial, Enterprise Mobility + Security, the cloud portion of Windows Commercial, the per-user portion of Power BI, Exchange, SharePoint, Microsoft Teams, Microsoft 365 Security and Compliance, and Microsoft 365 Copilot 16% / 15% 12% / 15% 18% / 16% 15% / 15% 17% / 15% 17% / 14% Microsoft 365 Commercial seat growth (y/y) Microsoft 365 Commercial seat growth: the number of Microsoft 365 Commercial seats at end of period where seats are paid users covered by a Microsoft 365 Commercial subscription 7% 7% 6% 6% 6% 6% Microsoft 365 Consumer cloud revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Microsoft 365 Consumer subscriptions and other consumer services 8% / 8% 10% / 12% 20% / 20% 11% / 12% 26% / 25% 29% / 27% LinkedIn revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Dynamics 365, including a set of intelligent, cloud-based applications across ERP, CRM, Power Apps, and Power Automate 19% / 18% 16% / 18% 23% / 21% 19% / 19% 18% / 16% 19% / 17% Azure and other cloud services revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Azure and other cloud services, including cloud and AI consumption-based services, GitHub cloud services, Nuance Healthcare cloud services, virtual desktop offerings, and other cloud services 31% / 31% 33% / 35% 39% / 39% 34% / 35% 40% / 39% 39% / 38% More Personal Computing Windows OEM and Devices revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from sales of Windows Pro and non-Pro licenses sold through the OEM channel and sales of first-party Devices, including Surface and PC accessories 4% / 4% 3% / 3% 3% / 3% 3% / 3% 6% / 6% 1% / 0% Xbox content and services revenue growth (y/y)* Revenue from Xbox content and services, comprising first- and third-party content (including games and in-game content), Xbox Game Pass and other subscriptions, Xbox Cloud Gaming, advertising, and other cloud services 2% / 2% 8% / 9% 13% / 12% 16% / 16% 1% / 0% -5% / -6% Search and news advertising revenue (ex TAC) growth (y/y)* Revenue from search and news advertising excluding traffic acquisition costs ("TAC") paid to Bing Ads network publishers and news partners 21% / 20% 21% / 23% 21% / 20% 20% / 21% 16% / 15% 10% / 9% * Includes Earnings Release Slides (http://aka.ms/slidesfy26q2) --> IMPORTANT NOTICE TO USERS (summary only, click here &nbsp;for full text of notice);&nbsp; All information is unaudited unless otherwise noted or accompanied by an audit opinion and is subject to the more comprehensive information contained in our SEC reports and filings. We do not endorse third-party information. All information speaks as of the last fiscal quarter or year for which we have filed a Form 10-K or 10-Q, or for historical information the date or period expressly indicated in or with such information. We undertake no duty to update the information. Forward-looking statements are subject to risks and uncertainties described in our&nbsp; Forms 10-Q and 10-K.
